title: inelasticsupply
author: inelasticsupply
content: Preferably graded 69/70 but would entertain upgraded examples as well. I would also want to use an escrow service... peace of mind for both of us. Thanks in advance.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: inelasticsupply on May 27, 2022, 11:32:11 PMPreferably graded 69/70 but would entertain upgraded examples as well. I would also want to use an escrow service... peace of mind for both of us. Thanks in advance. As always, it would be helpful to know what sort of pricing you had in mind for an item like this.  I've seen these particular coins sell for anywhere between 0.2-0.35 BTC fairly recently, so knowing what sort of price you were looking to pay would be helpful to potential sellers.  Good luck with your purchase and as always I'm available for escrow should it be needed.

comments.author: blucepheus
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on May 28, 2022, 11:39:12 PMQuote from: inelasticsupply on May 27, 2022, 11:32:11 PMPreferably graded 69/70 but would entertain upgraded examples as well. I would also want to use an escrow service... peace of mind for both of us. Thanks in advance. As always, it would be helpful to know what sort of pricing you had in mind for an item like this.  I've seen these particular coins sell for anywhere between 0.2-0.35 BTC fairly recently, so knowing what sort of price you were looking to pay would be helpful to potential sellers.  Good luck with your purchase and as always I'm available for escrow should it be needed.I see it differently. From my perspective, onus is on the seller to name their price. At least that’s how I do business.

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Quote from: blucepheus on May 29, 2022, 12:07:44 AMQuote from: OgNasty on May 28, 2022, 11:39:12 PMQuote from: inelasticsupply on May 27, 2022, 11:32:11 PMPreferably graded 69/70 but would entertain upgraded examples as well. I would also want to use an escrow service... peace of mind for both of us. Thanks in advance. As always, it would be helpful to know what sort of pricing you had in mind for an item like this.  I've seen these particular coins sell for anywhere between 0.2-0.35 BTC fairly recently, so knowing what sort of price you were looking to pay would be helpful to potential sellers.  Good luck with your purchase and as always I'm available for escrow should it be needed.I see it differently. From my perspective, onus is on the seller to name their price. At least that’s how I do business. Onus is on the seller to name price when theres an abundance of product. When the product is rare its up to the buyer to entice the seller to bring the product out of hiding.

comments.author: Eodguy149
comments.body: There's one available here. Feel free to make an offer  https://4k.com/market/collectible/44

comments.author: inelasticsupply
comments.body: Would pay more than .25... Please offer!

comments.author: Eodguy149
comments.body: Quote from: kryme on June 02, 2022, 02:17:46 AMQuote from: Eodguy149 on May 31, 2022, 05:19:27 AMThere's one available here. Feel free to make an offer  https://4k.com/market/collectible/44transitions failing every time I put a WETH offer in. gg 4k Oh really? Super weird. Can you DM a screenshot of the error you get? I can contact the team directly to try and resolve. Sometimes you have to refresh the page/reconnect your wallet and that fixes things.
